ai.BitModel

Class BitMoveEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • ai.BitModel.BitMoveEngine

  • public class BitMoveEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    Engine that uses the BitPatterns class to generate real chess moves in BitMap notation should be able to run concurrently

      • getBishopMoveMasks

        public long[] getBishopMoveMasks()
        returns move masks for all bishops of specified color on board. a move mask is a bit pattern such that oldBishopMap ^ moveMask == newBishopMask. this means it has bits set for start and end position (oldStart = 1) ^ (bitMask = 1) is thus set to 0 (oldEnd = 0) ^ (bitMask = 1) is thus set to 1 if this detects a collision, we should also xor adversary map shadow, since it might have failed because of some piece to capture was there.
        Parameters:
        forWhite -
        Returns:

      • getKingMoveMasks

        public long[] getKingMoveMasks()
        does not currently check for check, but rather every method uses the filterInCheck method @see filterInCheck to filter BitBoards in check
        Parameters:
        forWhite -
        Returns:

        public static boolean isBitBoardInCheck(BitBoard board)
        checks that the king of the player who last made a move is not in check that means it checks for the player who is not to move (i.e. !board.isWhiteMove )
        Parameters:
